sect2.title: Introduction to Fuse2
sect2.para: FUSE, or Filesystem in Userspace, allows userspace programs to create virtual filesystems. This is a really helpful technology, and the current Fuse version is major version 3. Fuse2 on the otherhand is still used by AppImages which rely on this technology. You may extract AppImages as you wish which would bypass this requirement, but other people opt to just install Fuse2 and run the AppImages directly.

sect2.title: Configuring Fuse2
sect2.para: Some options regarding mount policy can be set in the file /etc/fuse.conf. To install the file, run the following command as the &root; user:

screen.userinput:
cat > /etc/fuse.conf << "EOF" # Set the maximum number of FUSE mounts allowed to non-root users. # The default is 1000. # #mount_max = 1000
# Allow non-root users to specify the 'allow_other' or 'allow_root' # mount options. # #user_allow_other EOF
